name: Whitemead Forest Park

reviews.text: 23 of us stayed here the end of half term, four deluxe log cabins all two bed next to each other and one three bed lodge. We had a fab time. Cabins were clean and well equipped, beautiful surroundings. Pool clean, gym well stocked. We use the bar a few times which, as always, is pricey. We didn't eat in the restaurant but the food looked good and menu not too expensive. The shop we only used for a paper but it didn't seem to stay open very late.
reviews.title: Brilliant time

reviews.text: We have just booked to go back again, eight of us this time so giving the bungalow a try. Well worth a visit.
reviews.title: CSMA Park in the Forest of Dean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Feb half-term break was the families 12th at Whitemead Forest Park (WFP)& we collectively enjoyed it as much as ever. We stayed in a Delux Plus Cabin (or lodge as they are now called) No 9 on Pondside Way which was very nice & lovely and warm despite the cold outside. The cabin was very clean & is ideally situated overlooking one of the Ponds.
reviews.title: third visit better than ever

reviews.text: The children swam everyday & danced in the evenings with Sammy & Harry the park mascots. The pool facilities are excellent & we found the water nice and warm throughout our stay. We stayed for a full week & even though the park was fully booked the facilities never appeared overly busy which was great.
reviews.title: As good as Center Parcs but half the size and cost!!

reviews.text: The staff are fantastic from Reception, Bar / Restaurant to the Maintenance crew & they can’t do enough for you.
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.text: Stayed here with husband and 2 kids aged 2 & 4. Last minute break and got good deal. We found the park fantastic. Great pool facilities, small soft play but kids loved it and great kids entertainment and activities. Large grasses area where everyone was playing ball games. Really nice setting. Only downside was that the lodge was a bit dirty. We washed all the pots and even hovered the floor. We didn't let this spoil our holiday though as I have seen much worse in other places. We will return to the park next year but will stay in one of the apartments next time. Great time away though. Park was great and staff were lovely.
reviews.title: Fab park, poor cleanliness of lodge.

reviews.text: We booked one of the apartments that can cater for up to 6 people, but on this occasion it was used only my wife and I who were taking a long weekend in the depths of winter to meet up with some friends. It had been snowing quite heavily and the lanes around the Forest of Dean had been blocked. The weather forecast was continuing cold with overnight frost it was all very "White Christmas" despite the fact that it was now the end January.
reviews.title: Arrived with enthusiasm and left disappointed

reviews.text: Our first floor apartment benefited from parking close by and it was very spacious for two, good for four, but we thought cramped for six people. It had 2 bathrooms (1 en suite) and a kitchen / dining / lounge area that had an impressive large panoramic window with a view over the fields. To reach the apartment we had to climb an external staircase made of wood with about 15 steps. We noticed a small warning sign on the landing about wet steps - and more of this later.
reviews.title: good holiday break

reviews.text: Once we had settled in we soon noticed that attention to detail was sadly lacking. The management thought these were small and easily rectified issues, but we were only staying for 3 nights and did not want to make a fuss - just relax and unwind. The list of things we picked up included:
reviews.title: A cut above a holiday camp

reviews.text: * the TV would not work owing to a poor connection in the aerial lead
reviews.title: Can't fault for out-of-season break

reviews.text: I recently attended a party night at whitemead along with 9 of my friends and would just like to thank everyone involved for a great evening! I don't usually comment on these things but with the welcome we received and great night we had thought i must. our table had all the menu choices between us and loved every mouth full. The staff were very friendly and good fun and the disco that was put on was exactly what you'd expect and want from a party night! Also the surroundings are very christmassy (i've returned since with the grandchildren to see Santa and ice skate, which was great also) I see a previous comment from someone that had not such a good experience but from our groups point of view this night was exactly what we expected and wanted. Well done whitemead! we will be back!
reviews.title: Great Whitemead Xmas party

reviews.text: My first visit to Whitemead was in 1978 when I was two years old and it was a very different place, only recently opened after the old manor house on the site was demolished and just three cabins were in place.
reviews.title: 35 years of visits

reviews.text: I've been visiting on and off ever since, particularly recently now that I have young children of my own. The old (cold) outdoor pool has been replaced with a modern indoor pool with Jacuzzis and children's pool, and there's now a modern bar and restaurant. The food isn't Michelin star, but not Little Chef either. The site is quiet and peaceful, with plenty of activities (e.g. outdoor kids play, zip wire, table tennis, video games etc.) and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Whitemead Christmas Parties

reviews.text: There's lots to do locally - I would recommend the Sculpture Trail, Clearwell Caves, Dean Forest Railway and Puzzlewood amongst others, and Symonds Yat and Tintern Abbey are close by. You can also enjoy miles of cycling and walking trails through the forest
reviews.title: lovely location

reviews.text: Whitemead is no doubt a lovely place to stay. We live in the Forest of Dean and I would have no qualms in recommending it as a holiday stay, BUT... DO NOT go here for a Christmas Party! We have just returned from one and the food is... TERRIBLE!! I acknowledge that they are catering for large numbers but this is no excuse. I started with Brie and Cranberry Filo parcel, it was edible but tasteless. The main course I had opted for was beef.... I would not sole my shoes with it or even feed it to my dog! I was unable to cut the beef and the first mouthful I took, I had to spit into my serviette... the veg was OK, but not remarkable. The dessert - 'Orange Torte' - was a tasteless cheesecake with an orange segment on the top!
reviews.title: Park excellent, out of season best, resaurant disappointing

reviews.text: Stayed in upstairs apartment with lovely open view. Very spacious and warm. Great value if you are a csma member. All staff charming and efficient. Daughter loved the pool . Plenty of half term activities on too. Been coming over 10 years now and enjoyed every stay.
reviews.title: Great value family holiday

reviews.text: We stayed in a delux log cabin ( also known as a lodge). The interior was lovely and clean and the furnishing looked as good as new. The cabins were a good size, nice and warm without being stuffy. The only downsides were a) the shower was luke warm at best, b) the bed was really uncomfy. I have never stayed somewhere before and had a bad nights sleep because of the bed, which shows how bad these were.
reviews.title: Brilliant facilities, uncomfy bed

reviews.text: The park facilities were great with the pool, hot tubs, gym, sauna, soft play and park. The facilities belong to the park but are open to the public so were busier than expected (we stayed mid week off peak in feb). Because the facilities aren't exclusive for guests it means they are a lot better than what the park could afford to offer exclusively, however I don't know how busy these would be during peak times.
reviews.title: Did not live up to expectations

reviews.text: There are public footpaths leading to the forest right next to the park. It would be good if the park could provide a couple of local walks or a brief guide to the local area.
reviews.title: Great stay but not all it was described to be on the website or supporting literature.

reviews.text: Luckily we were ready to check out early as the cleaning staff arrived half an hour before our check out time!
reviews.title: Glamping Pod - An affordable and fun novelty

description: Whitemead Forest Park is a Leisure Retreat owned by CSMA Club. The Park lies in the heart of the Forest of Dean and offers a perfect base for exploring this stunning area. Our log cabin and apartment accommodation is modern and spacious and you can even bring you tent or caravan to make the most of the great outdoors. Our extensive facilities and program of entertainment offer something for everyone.
